text: hello this is chef john from food wishes
comm with creamy blue cheese dressing
that's right i'm going to show you my
top secret method for making blue cheese
dressing not to be confused with a top
secret recipe because that's not what
this is my blue cheese dressing recipe
is pretty straightforward but it's the
method to get the blue cheese into the
dressing that's my highly guarded secret
but i've held out long enough and i'm
now prepared to show you alright so step
one we got to make the creamy dressing
base and we're going to use the Holy
Trinity of all creamy dressing bases
which would be mayonnaise regular
full-fat mayonnaise some sour cream and
or creme fraiche and yes you yogurt
people plain yogurt should work here and
then last but not least buttermilk and
sometimes I'll adjust the amount of
buttermilk depending on how thick I want
this alright if I'm going to use it for
a straight salad dressing I like it a
little thinner if I'm doing it for a dip
I might do it a little thicker but it's
up to you you have to take personal
responsibility for your salad dressings
viscosity and once our base is together
we can start flavoring this up I'm going
to go with a little bit of crushed
garlic and I'm saying crushed but you
know what actually did that on the
microplane I just graded a clove works
pretty good we're also going to add some
freshly ground black pepper some dry
mustard a nice healthy dose of cayenne
we're going to need some salts and a
little bit of sugar and of course those
little brown drips would indicate that
we're also about to put in some W sauce
which is what I now call wishers Shire
sauce since I gave up trying to
pronounce it okay so a little capital W
sauce and we're going to take a whisk
and we're going to mix that very
thoroughly so give that a nice whisking
all right this is what whisking looks
like from the side view and then
whisking from the top view okay so is
everybody clear on the whisking
so once the base of your creamy blue
cheese dressing is done its ready to
introduce the most important ingredient
the blue cheese and here's what I
believe is the ultimate method for
accomplishing that we're going to use
one of these we've all heard that saying
grater is going to grate so if you take
a frozen piece of blue cheese which is
what I have right here I put that in the
freezer for at least an hour the
molecules will slow down significantly
and it will harden up and when you take
that frozen piece of blue cheese and you
rub it on that grater which you get is
little frozen chips of blue cheese
ease and I'm not sure why I'm doing this
on the cutting board let's do it into
the dressing and if you grate that
frozen blue cheese into your dressing
because you're getting such beautiful
small shavings it's going to incorporate
perfectly as opposed to the chunks which
just fall to the bottom so what I like
to do is grate a little bit stir it in
then grate a little more and stir it in
I don't want to clump it all together so
give it a stir
grate in some more give it a stir until
the wedge is gone so crumbling blue
cheese in here totally will work it's
just a lot Messier and like I said what
you end up with is a creamy salad
dressing with chunks of blue cheese in
it
versus a blue cheese dressing I want my
blue cheese dressing to taste basically
like liquefied blue cheese and with this
grater method those pieces of cheese are
so nice and small and thin that they
stay suspended in the dressing so every
single bite has just about the same
amount of blue cheesy flavor and it's
not like you got a wait to bite into a
blue cheese chunk to get that and also
because of all that extra surface area
from the grading we don't end up having
to use as much so it really works on
many levels and once your bleu cheese
has been graded in I'm gonna give that
one last stirring with the whisk and
that is one gorgeous blue cheese
dressing and then once that's done I
like to wrap it in plastic and
refrigerate it for at least three or
four hours you want to give those
flavors time to meld all right
overnights even better I guess
technically this is optional but I
really do think it tastes better if you
let it sit so actually let mine sit
overnight after which I served it up on
a wedge salad so I have a quarter head
of iceberg lettuce some red onions some
cherry tomatoes and of course if you do
like the big chunks crumble some on I'm
actually gonna use the same technique
with the grater and just put a little
more on top of mine like that and that
was absolutely delicious and you got to
love the wedge salad because you need a
fork and a knife to eat it it's just
like eating a steak except its lettuce
and not nearly as satisfying all right
but this amazing blue cheese dressing
more than made up for that I think and
really my only complaint with this salad
I didn't put nearly enough blue cheese
dressing on so let me fix that and like
I said every bite is bursting with blue
cheese flavor because we use the old
graders get a great method so even if
you already have your own favorite blue
cheese dressing recipe you can still use
the grater technique to get the cheese
in there so I hope you give that a try
